etymologies: mid 19th century (in acupressure (sense 2)): from acu- (in acupuncture) + pressure; in acupressure (sense 1), which dates from the 1970s, the word was chosen to reflect the close association of the therapy with acupuncture

shortDefinitions: form of alternative therapy in which manual pressure is used to stimulate specific points on body along what are considered to be lines of energy

definitions: a method of controlling bleeding involving the use of a needle to apply pressure to a ruptured blood vessel.
shortDefinitions: method of controlling bleeding involving pressure with needle
